intro: Myosotis glauca, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers with a white center. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its stems are slender and often branched. Myosotis glauca is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine.
